sentences: Ta ei taha minuga enam rääkida, ta on lihtsalt pahane ja vihane.
Ma tean, et sa oled endiselt õnnelik, aga ma olen murelik sinu pärast.
context: The word 'ent' in Estonian is used to describe a state of anger or being upset. It’s similar to the English words ‘angry’, ‘mad’, or ‘furious’. It can be used to express temporary irritation or deep-seated rage.
